text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to a command of God our Saviour, and of the Lord Jesus Christ our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text: to Timotheus -- genuine child in faith: Grace, kindness, peace, from God our Father, and Christ Jesus our Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: according as I did exhort thee to remain in Ephesus -- I going on to Macedonia -- that thou mightest charge certain not to teach any other thing,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, that cause questions rather than the building up of God that is in faith: --
speaker: Narrator

text: And the end of the charge is love out of a pure heart, and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned,
speaker: Narrator

text: from which certain, having swerved, did turn aside to vain discourse,
speaker: Narrator

text: willing to be teachers of law, not understanding either the things they say, nor concerning what they asseverate,
speaker: Narrator

text: and we have known that the law [is] good, if any one may use it lawfully;
speaker: Narrator

text: having known this, that for a righteous man law is not set, but for lawless and insubordinate persons, ungodly and sinners, impious and profane, parricides and matricides, men-slayers,
speaker: Narrator

text: whoremongers, sodomites, men-stealers, liars, perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that to sound doctrine is adverse,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the good news of the glory of the blessed God, with which I was entrusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I give thanks to him who enabled me -- Christ Jesus our Lord -- that he did reckon me stedfast, having put [me] to the ministration,
speaker: Narrator

text: who before was speaking evil, and persecuting, and insulting, but I found kindness, because, being ignorant, I did [it] in unbelief,
speaker: Narrator

text: and exceedingly abound did the grace of our Lord, with faith and love that [is] in Christ Jesus:
speaker: Narrator

text: stedfast [is] the word, and of all acceptation worthy, that Christ Jesus came to the world to save sinners -- first of whom I am;
speaker: Narrator

text: but because of this I found kindness, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all long-suffering, for a pattern of those about to believe on him to life age-during:
speaker: Narrator

text: and to the King of the ages, the incorruptible, invisible, only wise God, [is] honour and glory -- to the ages of the ages! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This charge I commit to thee, child Timotheus, according to the prophesies that went before upon thee, that thou mayest war in them the good warfare,
speaker: Narrator

text: having faith and a good conscience, which certain having thrust away, concerning the faith did make shipwreck,
speaker: Narrator

text: of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I did deliver to the Adversary, that they might be instructed not to speak evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I exhort, then, first of all, there be made supplications, prayers, intercessions, thanksgivings, for all men:
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings, and all who are in authority, that a quiet and peaceable life we may lead in all piety and gravity,
speaker: Narrator

text: for this [is] right and acceptable before God our Saviour,
speaker: Narrator

text: who doth will all men to be saved, and to come to the full knowledge of the truth;
speaker: Narrator

text: for one [is] God, one also [is] mediator of God and of men, the man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who did give himself a ransom for all -- the testimony in its own times --
speaker: Narrator

text: in regard to which I was set a preacher and apostle -- truth I say in Christ, I do not lie -- a teacher of nations, in faith and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I wish, therefore, that men pray in every place, lifting up kind hands, apart from anger and reasoning;
speaker: Narrator

text: in like manner also the women, in becoming apparel, with modesty and sobriety to adorn themselves, not in braided hair, or gold, or pearls, or garments of great price,
speaker: Narrator

text: but -- which becometh women professing godly piety -- through good works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a woman in quietness learn in all subjection,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a woman I do not suffer to teach, nor to rule a husband, but to be in quietness,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Adam was first formed, then Eve,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been deceived, into transgression came,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she shall be saved through the child-bearing, if they remain in faith, and love, and sanctification, with sobriety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stedfast [is] the word: If any one the oversight doth long for, a right work he desireth;
speaker: Narrator

text: it behoveth, therefore, the overseer to be blameless, of one wife a husband, vigilant, sober, decent, a friend of strangers, apt to teach,
speaker: Narrator

text: not given to wine, not a striker, not given to filthy lucre, but gentle, not contentious, not a lover of money,
speaker: Narrator

text: his own house leading well, having children in subjection with all gravity,
speaker: Narrator

text: (and if any one his own house [how] to lead hath not known, how an assembly of God shall he take care of?)
speaker: Narrator

text: not a new convert, lest having been puffed up he may fall to a judgment of the devil;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it behoveth him also to have a good testimony from those without, that he may not fall into reproach and a snare of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ministrants -- in like manner grave, not double-tongued, not given to much wine, not given to filthy lucre,
speaker: Narrator

text: having the secret of the faith in a pure conscience,
speaker: Narrator

text: and let these also first be proved, then let them minister, being unblameable.
speaker: Narrator

text: Women -- in like manner grave, not false accusers, vigilant, faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ministrants -- let them be of one wife husbands; the children leading well, and their own houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: for those who did minister well a good step to themselves do acquire, and much boldness in faith that [is] in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things I write to thee, hoping to come unto thee soon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if I delay, that thou mayest know how it behoveth [thee] to conduct thyself in the house of God, which is an assembly of the living God -- a pillar and foundation of the truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and, confessedly, great is the secret of piety -- God was manifested in flesh, declared righteous in spirit, seen by messengers, preached among nations, believed on in the world, taken up in glory!
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit expressly speaketh, that in latter times shall certain fall away from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits and teachings of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: in hypocrisy speaking lies, being seared in their own conscience,
speaker: Narrator

text: forbidding to marry -- to abstain from meats that God created to be received with thanksgiving by those believing and acknowledging the truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: because every creature of God [is] good, and nothing [is] to be rejected, with thanksgiving being received,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is sanctified through the word of God and intercession.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things placing before the brethren, thou shalt be a good ministrant of Jesus Christ, being nourished by the words of the faith, and of the good teaching, which thou didst follow after,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the profane and old women's fables reject thou, and exercise thyself unto piety,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the bodily exercise is unto little profit, and the piety is to all things profitable, a promise having of the life that now is, and of that which is coming;
speaker: Narrator

text: stedfast [is] the word, and of all acceptation worthy;
speaker: Narrator

text: for for this we both labour and are reproached, because we hope on the living God, who is Saviour of all men -- especially of those believing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Charge these things, and teach;
speaker: Narrator

text: let no one despise thy youth, but a pattern become thou of those believing in word, in behaviour, in love, in spirit, in faith, in purity;
speaker: Narrator

text: till I come, give heed to the reading, to the exhortation, to the teaching;
speaker: Narrator

text: be not careless of the gift in thee, that was given thee through prophecy, with laying on of the hands of the eldership;
speaker: Narrator

text: of these things be careful; in these things be, that thy advancement may be manifest in all things;
speaker: Narrator

text: take heed to thyself, and to the teaching; remain in them, for this thing doing, both thyself thou shalt save, and those hearing thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: An aged person thou mayest not rebuke, but be entreating as a father; younger persons as brethren;
speaker: Narrator

text: aged women as mothers, younger ones as sisters -- in all purity;
speaker: Narrator

text: honour widows who are really widows;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if any widow have children or grandchildren, let them learn first to their own house to show piety, and to give back a recompense to the parents, for this is right and acceptable before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she who is really a widow and desolate, hath hoped upon God, and doth remain in the supplications and in the prayers night and day,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she who is given to luxury, living -- hath died;
speaker: Narrator

text: and these things charge, that they may be blameless;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if any one for his own -- and especially for those of the household -- doth not provide, the faith he hath denied, and than an unbeliever he is worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: A widow -- let her not be enrolled under sixty years of age, having been a wife of one husband,
speaker: Narrator

text: in good works being testified to: if she brought up children, if she entertained strangers, if saints' feet she washed, if those in tribulation she relieved, if every good work she followed after;
speaker: Narrator

text: and younger widows be refusing, for when they may revel against the Christ, they wish to marry,
speaker: Narrator

text: having judgment, because the first faith they did cast away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and at the same time also, they learn [to be] idle, going about the houses; and not only idle, but also tattlers and busybodies, speaking the things they ought not;
speaker: Narrator

text: I wish, therefore, younger ones to marry, to bear children, to be mistress of the house, to give no occasion to the opposer to reviling;
speaker: Narrator

text: for already certain did turn aside after the Adversary.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any believing man or believing woman have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the assembly be burdened, that those really widows it may relieve.
speaker: Narrator

text: The well-leading elders of double honour let them be counted worthy, especially those labouring in word and teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Writing saith, `An ox treading out thou shalt not muzzle,' and `Worthy [is] the workman of his reward.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Against an elder an accusation receive not, except upon two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those sinning, reprove before all, that the others also may have fear;
speaker: Narrator

text: I testify fully, before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the choice messengers, that these things thou mayest keep, without forejudging, doing nothing by partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be laying hands quickly on no one, nor be having fellowship with sins of others; be keeping thyself pure;
speaker: Narrator

text: no longer be drinking water, but a little wine be using, because of thy stomach and of thine often infirmities;
speaker: Narrator

text: of certain men the sins are manifest beforehand, leading before to judgment, and certain also they follow after;
speaker: Narrator

text: in like manner also the right works are manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise are not able to be hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many as are servants under a yoke, their own masters worthy of all honour let them reckon, that the name of God and the teaching may not be evil spoken of;
speaker: Narrator

text: and those having believing masters, let them not slight [them], because they are brethren, but rather let them serve, because they are stedfast and beloved, who of the benefit are partaking. These things be teaching and exhorting;
speaker: Narrator

text: if any one be teaching otherwise, and do not consent to sound words -- those of our Lord Jesus Christ -- and to the teaching according to piety,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and word-striving, out of which doth come envy, strife, evil-speakings, evil-surmisings,
speaker: Narrator

text: wranglings of men wholly corrupted in mind, and destitute of the truth, supposing the piety to be gain; depart from such;
speaker: Narrator

text: but it is great gain -- the piety with contentment;
speaker: Narrator

text: for nothing did we bring into the world -- [it is] manifest that we are able to carry nothing out;
speaker: Narrator

text: but having food and raiment -- with these we shall suffice ourselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: and those wishing to be rich, do fall into temptation and a snare, and many desires, foolish and hurtful, that sink men into ruin and destruction,
speaker: Narrator

text: for a root of all the evils is the love of money, which certain longing for did go astray from the faith, and themselves did pierce through with many sorrows;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou, O man of God, these things flee, and pursue righteousness, piety, faith, love, endurance, meekness;
speaker: Narrator

text: be striving the good strife of the faith, be laying hold on the life age-during, to which also thou wast called, and didst profess the right profession before many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I charge thee, before God, who is making all things alive, and of Christ Jesus, who did testify before Pontius Pilate the right profession,
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou keep the command unspotted, unblameable, till the manifestation of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which in His own times He shall shew -- the blessed and only potentate, the King of the kings and Lord of the lords,
speaker: Narrator

text: who only is having immortality, dwelling in light unapproachable, whom no one of men did see, nor is able to see, to whom [is] honour and might age-during! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those rich in the present age charge thou not to be high-minded, nor to hope in the uncertainty of riches, but in the living God, who is giving to us all things richly for enjoyment; --
speaker: Narrator

text: to do good, to be rich in good works, to be ready to impart, willing to communicate,
speaker: Narrator

text: treasuring up to themselves a right foundation for the time to come, that they may lay hold on the life age-during.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Timotheus, the thing entrusted guard thou, avoiding the profane vain-words and opposition of the falsely-named knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text: which certain professing -- concerning the faith did swerve; the grace [is] with you. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
